get.summary: Get a list of employments for a given client.
get.description:
Get a list of client's employments. Some specific filtering is optionally supported.
The following field is supported for in
id
Examples: top=5&skip=22&filter= id in '(987,654,126)

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Client Id - The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Supports filtering by id (in), e.g.: filter=id in (123, 124)

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip. Must be greater than or equal to zero

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of records to retrieve (default 100, max 500)

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

post.summary: Creates an expenditure record for a client.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Details of the expenditure to be created.

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

Preference-Applied.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

get.summary: Returns a list of expenditure records for a client. The returned list may be filtered.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
The returned list of questions can be filtered using one or more of the following supported fields and operators:
            
* `id` (`in`)
* `frequency` (`in`, `eq`, `ne`)
            
Usage examples:
* `filter=id in (1,2)`
* `filter=frequency eq 'Monthly' or frequency in ('Weekly','Monthly')`.
            
For further details of how to use the filter parameter see [QueryLang](docs/ApiQueryLang).

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Optional. Number of records to skip. Must be greater than or equal to zero. Defaults to zero if not specified.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Optional. The number of records to retrieve (max 500). Defaults to 100 if not specified.

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

Preference-Applied.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: expenditureId
parameters.description: The identifier for the expenditure record to update.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The updated details for the expenditure.

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

Preference-Applied.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: expenditureId
parameters.description: The id of the expenditure record.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

Preference-Applied.description: Used to indicate which format the expenditure categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: expenditureId
parameters.description: The identifier of the expenditure record.

get.summary: Returns a list of incomes for a given client.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
The returned list of questions can be filtered using one or more of the following supported fields and operators:
            
* `id` (`in`)
* `employment.id` (`in`, `eq`)
* `frequency` (`in`, `eq`)
* `lastupdated` (`eq`,`ne`,`in`,`gt`,`ge`,`lt`,`le`)
            
Usage examples:
* `filter=id in (1,2)`
* `filter=employment.id eq 22 and id in (1,2)`
* `filter=frequency eq 'Single' or frequency in ('Single','Monthly')`.
            
For further details of how to use the filter parameter see [QueryLang](docs/ApiQueryLang).

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: Used to indicate which format the income categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Optional. Number of records to skip. Must be greater than or equal to zero. Defaults to zero if not specified.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Optional. The number of records to retrieve (max 500). Defaults to 100 if not specified.

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

Preference-Applied.description: Used to indicate which format the income categories are returned in. Valid options are: 'x-iflo-apiversion=1' or 'x-iflo-apiversion=2'. If not specified the default is 'x-iflo-apiversion=1'

get.summary: Retrieves List of all/matched categories based on the filter provided.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
List can be filtered using one or more supported fields and operators below.
Supported Filters:
* `group  ` (`eq`)
* `party_types ` (`in`)
Usage examples:
* `?filter=group eq 'Basic Quality of Living' or party_types in ('Person') `.
See [QueryLang](docs/ApiQueryLang) for further details of how to use the filtering and sorting parameters.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip. Must be greater than or equal to zero (default).

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Tenant to which user belongs to.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of records to retrieve (default 100, max 500).

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

get.summary: Get the list of Reference Data.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
List can be filtered using one or more supported fields and operators below.
Supported Filters:
* `regioncode` (`in`, `eq`)
Usage examples:
* `filter=regioncode eq 'gb' or regioncode in ('gb','au')`.
See [QueryLang](docs/ApiQueryLang) for further details of how to use the filtering and sorting parameters.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the reference data you want to retrieve. Supported types :categories

Content-Type.description: Content type for the returned resource

occupation.description: Description of the occupation of the employment

employmentBusinessType.description: Employment Business type, settable for business types: Sole Trader, Private Limited Company, Partnership, Limited Liability Partnership

inProbation.description: In Probation flag, settable for statuses: Employed, MaternityLeave, LongTermIllness

probationPeriodInMonths.description: Settable when InProbation is set to 'true' and for statuses: Employed, MaternityLeave, LongTermIllness

includeInAffordability.description: Specifies whether income is included in affordability

startsOn.description: Start Date of the income (not settable for employment income).

endsOn.description: End Date of the income (not settable for employment income).

employmentStatus.description: Employment Status, 'Unknown' Employment Status is not allowed on CreateEmployment

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth - min value: 01/01/1900 - max value: Current Date

ageCustom.description: Age Custom - min value: 0 - max value: 250

ageCustomUntil.description: Age Until Custom - min value: 0 - max value: 250

isLivingWith.description: Specifies whether dependant is living with client(s)

isFinanciallyDependant.description: Specifies whether dependant is financially dependant

financialDependencyEndsOn.description: Financial dependency end date - min value: 01/01/1900 - max value: 31/12/2150

code.description: Subdivision of country according to the ISO-3166-2 standard.

isLiabilityToBeRepaid.description: Is liability to be repaid flag

discriminator.description: Discriminator for identifying the targeted notes field.

type.description: Resource type for the ref data.

property.description: Property on the resource type for the ref data.

properties.description: Custom properties.Key value pairs, Limited to 10 items.

archived.description: Archived status of the ref data.

IncomeCreated.description: Event is raised any time a income is created.

topics.name: IncomeCreated
topics.description: Any time a income is created.

topics.name: IncomeCreated/*
topics.description: Any time a income is created.

IncomeChanged.description: Event is raised any time a income is changed.

topics.name: IncomeChanged
topics.description: Any time a income is changed.

topics.name: IncomeChanged/*
topics.description: Any time a income is changed.

topics.name: IncomeChanged/{incomeId}
topics.description: Any time a income with the specified 'incomeId' is changed.
